meanings.definition: To allow entry before an official admission.
meanings.sent1: The museum preadmits members an hour before opening to the public.
meanings.sent2: Please preadmit the VIP guests to the party before the general attendees.
meanings.sent3: The preadmit system ensures smooth access for early arrivals.
meanings.sent4: He preadmitted his friends to the club before it reached full capacity.
meanings.sent5: Preadmitting passengers with special needs is a priority for airlines.

meanings.definition: To grant access prior to formal acceptance.
meanings.sent1: The university may preadmit exceptional students based on their achievements.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to preadmit interns for a trial period before hiring.
meanings.sent3: Preadmitting members to the exclusive club requires a thorough background check.
meanings.sent4: She preadmitted him to the secret meeting to gather his opinion beforehand.
meanings.sent5: Preadmitting applicants to the program gives them a head start in their studies.
